title: Practice Challenge
description: Practice using comments! Add a single-line comment above the `console.log` explaining what the code does. Then, comment out the second `console.log` (so it doesn't run) using `//`.
instructions:
1.  Add a single-line comment (`//`) above the first line explaining it.
2.  Comment out the second line so it does not execute.

testCases.description: Only the first message is displayed

hints.text: Put `//` at the beginning of the line you want to comment out.

commonMistakes.correction: While `//comment` works, `// comment` is much easier to read.
`/* /* nested */ */` doesn't work. Once the computer sees the first `*/`, it thinks the comment is over.

commonMistakes.consequence: Code after the comment won't run.
commonMistakes.correction: Make sure to always close with `*/`
